Key Match Events: Ireland upset England by five runs in a rainy Twenty20 World Cup Group 1 game decided on the Duckworth-Lewis-Stern method.
Ireland posted 157 in 19.2 overs with skipper Andy Balbirnie scoring 62 from 47 balls and Lorcan Tucker scoring 34.
England finished 105 for five from 14.3 overs with Josh Little taking 2-16 to lead the Irish attack.
Liam Livingstone took 3-17 in three overs and missed a hat trick.
England was down to 29-3 in 5.1 overs, losing Jos Buttler for a two-ball duck.
Joshua Little struck again as Alex Hales was out caught for seven runs.
Fionn Hand bowled Ben Stokes for six runs.
Dawid Malan scored 35 off 37 balls and put on 38 runs with Harry Brook.
Moeen Ali scored 24 not out off 12 balls towards the end, but rain thwarted his plans.
Pre-Game Insights: England retained the same starting XI that opened the Super 12 stage with a five-wicket win over Afghanistan.
Ireland made one change, with Fionn Hand coming in for batting allrounder Simi Singh.
Post-Match Reflections: England captain Jos Buttler said, 'We were poor in the first 10 overs and let Ireland get away. We let them score freely on both sides and were not consistent [bowling].'
Jos Buttler added, 'We won the toss and bowled first, knowing what we needed to do. We didn't take advantage of it.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The start was delayed by 15 minutes before another 25-minute delay after only 1.3 overs were bowled.
Ireland was 92-1 at the end of 10 overs.
Ireland lost nine wickets for 54 runs in less than eight overs.
Mark Wood finished with 3-34 and Sam Curran took 2-31.
Defeat pushed England down to third in its group with Ireland fourth.
Ireland will play Afghanistan next at the MCG on Friday when England will take on defending champions Australia.
